definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
category/genus (taxonomy)/family members/dependents/to belong to/subordinate to/affiliated with/be born in the year of (one of the 12 animals)/to be/to prove to be/to constitute
to join together/to fix one's attention on/to concentrate on
stick/club/cudgel/smart/capable/strong/wonderful/classifier for legs of a relay race

sentences.english: A hollow metal rod with a heavy rubber tip or tips that is wielded and twirled by a drum major or drum majorette.
sentences.chinese: 鼓手揮舞使用的，頂端是厚橡皮的中空的金屬棒。

sentences.english: That piece of metal in her back hurts almost all the time.
sentences.chinese: 後背裏的那條金屬棒一直讓她隱隱作痛。

sentences.english: A hollow metal rod with a heavy rubber tip or tips that is wielded and twirled by a drum major or drum majorette .
sentences.chinese: 鼓手揮舞使用的，頂端是厚橡皮的中空的金屬棒。

sentences.english: He filed away at the metal bar.
Suppose I take a bar of metal, and I banded it.
sentences.chinese: 假如我拿一個金屬棒，折一下。

sentences.english: Two prongs let you connect it to heat sources or use as handles.
sentences.chinese: 在版的兩端各黏上一金屬棒來連接熱源。

sentences.english: The metal bar could be elongated under intense heat.
sentences.chinese: 這金屬棒在高熱下能被拉長。

sentences.english: The worker has fined the metal bar down.
sentences.chinese: 工人把這根金屬棒磨細了。

sentences.english: The loud noise, the bar, the bang.
sentences.chinese: 那個響聲，重擊金屬棒發出的聲音。

sentences.english: He sank the metal rod in before the concrete set.
sentences.chinese: 他在混凝土凝固之前把金屬棒插了進去。
